##  Edit Role Flow
**Design Page:** [View in Figma](https://www.figma.com/design/Z93EYKSa1MdBmXndsMBJSQ/Care---Master?node-id=29325-39988&p=f&t=G1AqA3LbMEQ0I1D8-11)

---

### Trigger
User clicks on the **‚ÄúEdit Role‚Äù** button within a **User Card**.

---

###  Navigation
System navigates to the **Edit Role** screen.

This screen displays key user information in a structured layout:

####  User Details Section
- **Profile Name** ‚Äì Full name of the selected user  
- **Username** ‚Äì System username or ID  
- **Current Role** ‚Äì Displays the user‚Äôs existing role  

---

### Role Selection Interaction
- Below the details, show a **Role selection field (dropdown)**.  
- When clicked, a **searchable dropdown** opens.

---

###  Update Action
- After selecting a role, the **‚ÄúUpdate Role‚Äù** button becomes active.  
- On clicking **Update Role**, the new role is **saved** for that user.

---

###  Success Feedback
Once the update is successful, display a confirmation alert at the top of the screen:

‚úÖ **‚ÄúUser role updated successfully.‚Äù**

## üîó Link User Section
**Design Page:** [View in Figma](https://www.figma.com/design/Z93EYKSa1MdBmXndsMBJSQ/Care---Master?node-id=29325-39988&p=f&t=G1AqA3LbMEQ0I1D8-11)

---

### Trigger
User clicks on **‚ÄúLink User‚Äù** from their dashboard or relevant screen.

---

### Search Step
A search field appears where the user can type the name of the person they want to link.

---

### Condition
#### ‚úÖ If the user exists:
Show the matching user and allow linking directly.

#### ‚ùå If the user does not exist:
Show an option to add a new user.

---

### Add User Shortcut
When clicking **‚ÄúAdd User‚Äù**:
‚Üí Redirect to the **Add User** screen.

---

### üéØ Design Intent
This allows users (like admins, doctors, or staff) to quickly create and link a new user **without navigating back to the homepage**, improving **efficiency** and **flow continuity**.

activity.title: ohcnetwork/design#12
activity.text:
### Solution

#### Navigation Menu Behavior
- When the navigation menu is in a **collapsed state** and the user clicks on a main menu item with a sub-menu:  
  - Automatically expand the navigation menu to **full view**.  
  - Keep it expanded until the user manually collapses it again.  
  - Remove the temporary **pop-out side menu** behavior.  

This ensures consistent navigation and makes accessing sub-menus more predictable.

#### Navigation Resizing
- When in the **expanded state**, the side navigation bar should be **draggable to resize**.  
- Apply constraints for resizing based on design specifications:  
  - **Minimum width:** collapsed state width.  
  - **Maximum width:** full expanded width.  

This resolves the current issue where the navigation is fixed and not resizable.

---

üìå **Note:**  
- The **Figma design file** will be attached.  
- Annotated sizes (min/max values) will also be included in the design file update.

activity.text: # üîß Design Update: Settings-Specified Menu ## Overview This menu type is introduced when a **Side Menu item has many sub-menus** (typically **7 or more**). In our current product, the **Settings section has 11 sub-menus**, so it is implemented as a specified menu. --- ## Components & States ### Sub-Menu Each sub-menu follows **3 states** - Default - Hovered - Active --- ## Why This Approach? - When a menu item contains a large number of sub-menus, the **side menu height increases significantly**. - To manage this, we use a **Settings-Specified Menu** pattern to handle the sub-menus more clearly and keep the navigation organized. --- ## Developer Notes - **Annotations** (widths, gaps, colors, spacing) are fully documented in the Figma file. üîó https://www.figma.com/design/m8Hr3royRxemx5VDOcHjsv/Care-Design_Tokens?node-id=2408-119&p=f&t=zOrixI28BfScy9eS-11
